---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7784882451/job/21226265684)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7784882451/job/21226265900)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7784882451/job/21226265421)

LGTM

My only comment is adding a symmetrical doc-string.

LGTM

My only comment is adding a symmetrical doc-string.
Maybe you could also add a pointer here to the other lemma, the one without the `'`?

This can be generalized:
```suggestion
lemma Irreducible.coprime_iff_not_dvd [Monoid α] {p n : α} (hp : Irreducible p) :
    (∀ d, d ∣ p → d ∣ n → IsUnit d) ↔ ¬ p ∣ n := by
  refine ⟨fun h contra ↦ hp.not_unit (h p (refl _) contra), fun hpn d hdp hdn ↦ ?_⟩
  contrapose! hpn
  suffices Associated p d from this.dvd.trans hdn
  exact (hp.dvd_iff.mp hdp).resolve_left hpn
```
I don't think you need to add a prime to the name because there is no clash with an existing name.
In fact there is a clash, see [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/PrincipalIdealDomain.html#Irreducible.coprime_iff_not_dvd).

This can be [strengthened](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/DecompositionMonoid?expand=1#diff-8088736f0d4b8a7f07a031cbe91d9579d9dc9c4057fa9008eb51a25c5c57ec43R106-R119) to require that y divides x.

I started the DecompositionMonoid refactoring in that branch, and I think every lemma in this file can be generalized to DceompositionMonoid (and two only require CancelCommMonoidWithZero as you can see). However this new lemma can't be generalized, since (assuming DecompositionMonoid) it implies factorizability into squarefree elements, which is the subject of Proposition 3.4 in [the paper](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00233-019-10022-3). Note that DecompositionMonoid + factorizability into irreducibles would imply UFM right away.

> This can be [strengthened](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/DecompositionMonoid?expand=1#diff-8088736f0d4b8a7f07a031cbe91d9579d9dc9c4057fa9008eb51a25c5c57ec43R106-R119) to require that y divides x.

Good point, I will add this.

> I started the DecompositionMonoid refactoring in that branch ...

Great, thanks for taking this on. As an aside, I would argue that your proposed `IsRelPrime` should really get the label `IsCoprime` and what is currently called `IsCoprime` should either be dropped or renamed something like `ExistsBezout` or `IsBezoutPair` or something.

Having Bezout in the name is nice; IsCoprime is equivalent to IsRelPrime in Bezout rings (`IsBezout`), and most results in Mathlib.RingTheory.PrincipalIdealDomain can be generalized to Bezout rings (but maybe the correct approach is to replace IsCoprime by IsRelPrime and use the equivalence when necessary ...). There is `IsBezout.gcd` but maybe it's better to allow a separate `GCDMonoid` instance and use that `gcd` so the lemmas won't just apply to the particular choice of `gcd`/generators.

Indeed most lemmas about IsRelPrime has `coprime` in their names instead. I think we have to use a new name (and IsRelPrime) is my choice, since IsCoprime is widely used and we'd like to deprecate it rather than renaming it right away. I won't rename the lemmas so that they have the right names when we later rename IsRelPrime back to IsCoprime. (But do we need to deprecate IsRelPrime then? Maybe it's better to rename IsCoprime right now ...)

I still think IsComaximal is a reasonable name, since `IsCoprime x y` is equivalent to the [comaximality](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/coprime.20ideal/near/395125656) (currently with the unintuitive name [Codisjoint](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Disjoint.html#Codisjoint)) of the ideals they generate, and also to the comaximality of the basic opens in the spectrum.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add lemma `exists_squarefree_dvd_pow_of_ne_zero`
